result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Counts are concurrent to each other and to 15CF695.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to have no contact with Family Dollar Store.  The Defendant is subject to random drug/UA testing.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol (can be in a restaurant to work but not the bar area).  The Defendant is to have a psychological assessment and follow any recommendations for treatment.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
